I don't hold out much hope for finding new ways to detect these people and keep them from possibly committing a terrible act. We can't even force ourselves to provide any help for the seriously mentally ill, instead leaving them to die on the streets.

To the contrary, there are powerful tools in our justice system to stop a person who threatens to harm others. All it takes is one other person who is brave enough, and knowledgeable enough, to take action.

A person threatened, or otherwise aware of the threats, can make a complaint with the police. The internet threats can be copied onto a disc or thumb drive and shown to the police.

If warranted, the police can obtain a warrant to search an internet account if a person threatens to harm others online. Then the internet threats become evidence and the threatening person can be arrested.

If the District Attorney prosecutes, the court can order bail in a high amount or even hold a suspect without bail until the person appears in court and, if ordered to do so, undergoes a psychological evaluation. If the charges and evidence warrant, the court can order that the threatening person be jailed or sent to a mental hospital.

Of course, the threatened person is granted various restraining orders throughout this process.

This is an action that can be taken by a person who feels that his or her life is in danger, or that other lives are in danger.

QFT deals with matter which is created and annihilated. Like in a particle accelerator or the Big Bang.

One can show that in any model for it, the space must be filled by, to put it simply, computations.

Physically they are the inner symmetry of the matter, so in a way they are the matter itself.

The usual math is binary, you add 2+3 and get 5. Organized in the shape of the letter Y with 2 and 3 entering and 5 exiting. The usual math fills this way only 2 dimensional surfaces, 1 space+1 time. The models of this kind are used on a 2d sheet, which is the string in string theory.

Particles, however, interact strongly with 3space+1time, and cannot therefore be caught by a 2d string.

Instead one needs some new, higher math, which fills 4d space. This is what I have developed for many years and will put out in a course.

What I found, unexpectedly, was that the higher computations are encoded into bends , or foldings, of space time. Which bends satisfy precisely Einstein's equations.

In the model I am aiming at, the lifelines of particles – lines as time passes – are surrounded by such computations. The only important things, as in all of science, are things which can be measured, which are probabilities for things to happen.
